contentrichtext.text: {{no footnotes|date=February 2013}} '''Otto Eckstein''' (August 1, 1927 – March 22, 1984) was a German-born [[economics|economist]] at [[Harvard University]], member of the [[President of the United States|President's]] [[Council of Economic Advisers]] from 1964 to 1968), and co-founder of [[Data Resources Inc]]. He received an A.B. from Princeton University and a Ph.D. from Harvard University. He was a key developer and proponent of the idea of [[core inflation]] {{harv|Eckstein|1981}}. A frequent coauthor was [[Allen Sinai]]. == Bibliography == {{Expand section|date=December 2009}} * {{cite|last=Eckstein|first=Otto|title=Core inflation|year=1981}} * {{cite|last=Eckstein|first=Otto|title=The DRI Model of the U.S. Economy|year=1983}} * {{Citation|last=Eckstein |first=Otto |coauthors=Allen Sinai |title=The American Business Cycle: Continuity and Change|editor=Robert J.
